p: Patients with DAI present with important impairment of consciousness from the moment of trauma [ 7]. DAI is the most common cause of persistent vegetative state and severe disability in TBI [ 8]. Damage to the reticular activating system is proportional to the level and duration of coma noted after DAI [ 6]. Autonomic dysfunction symptoms seen in DAI (such as temperature control and satiety center disorders) have been associated with injury to the hypothalamus, which controls these activities [ 6].
